00002 #include <stdio.h>

00006 #include "cap.h"
00007 #include "version.h"
00008 #include "analyserpxAggreg.h"
00009 #include "expressions.h"

00012 char fileName[256] = "cap0";
00013 char baseFileName[100] = "cap";
00014 char logFileName[100] = "logcap";
00015 int tFlag = 1;
00016 
00017 int analyserpxError = 0;
00018 int STR_MAX_LEN = 1474;
00019 
00020 void printHelp( char *progname ){
00021 
00022 fprintf( stderr, "%s version " ANALYSERPXCAP_VERSION "\n", progname);
00023 fprintf( stderr, "%s monitors, collects and store traffic that is \n\
00024 visible in a interface. The packets are classified and aggregated \n\
00025 into flows and stored on a binary file. The binay file can be read by \n\
00026 the analyserpx_read program and the flows printed on screen in text format. \n\
00027 \n\
00028 Usage:  %s [-h] [-c count] [-i interface] [ -s snaplen ] [-w file] \n\
00029              [-e expression] [-t administrative time] [-l logFileName] \n\
00030              [-r input file] [-z number of time bins to change the output] \n\
00031 where\n\
00032 -h      this message\n\
00033 -c      Maximum number of frames to be capured (Default=0 (infinity))\n\
00034 -i      Specify the interface to be listened (Default=active interface)\n\
00035 -s      Maximum number of bytes to be captured in each frame (Default: 1518)\n\
00036 -w      File prefix where collected data will be stored (Default: cap)\n\
00037 -e      Select the traffic that will be captured. See tcpdump expression \n\
00038         for more details (Default: ip)\n\
00039 -t      Specify the time out in seconds (time bin)  for expired flows to be \n\
00040         flushed out of the memory (Default: 300)\n\
00041 -z      Specify how many time bins will be considered to generate a new \n\
00042         output file name. As default, 0 means all day long (Default: 0)\n\
00043 -r      Input file to offline capture\n\
00044 -l      Specify the log file name (Default: logcap)\n\
00045 \n\
00046 Examples:\n\
00047 %s -i eth0 -s 1518 -w cap -e ip -t 300 -l log\n\
00048         Captures flows of ip traffic from eth0 with at \n\
00049         maximum 1518 bytes length. The flows will be stored \n\
00050         on the files cap0, cap1...\n\
00051 \n\
00052 %s -w cap\n\
00053         Captures all traffic from the active interface.\n\
00054 ", progname, progname, progname, progname  );
00055 }
00056 
00057 int main(int argc, char **argv){
00058 
00059     loadExpressions();
00060     
00061     int index;
00062     int c;
00063     opterr = 0;
00064     cap_config *conf = new_cap_config();
00065     char *offLineFile = NULL;
00066     char *data=NULL;
00067     int fileAdminTime = 300;
00068     int fileExpTime = 0;
00069     time_t tempo = 0;
00070 
00071     while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "hi:w:c:s:e:t:z:l:r:")) != -1){
00072         switch (c) {
00073         case 'i':
00074             snprintf(conf->dev,10,"%s",optarg);
00075             break;
00076         case 'w':
00077             snprintf(baseFileName,100,"%s",optarg);
00078             time(&tempo);
00079             data = (char *) (malloc(sizeof(char)*7));
00080             getDate(&tempo,data,6) ;
00081             snprintf(fileName,256,"%s%s_0",baseFileName,data);
00082             free(data);
00083             break;
00084         case 'c':
00085             conf->numOfPackets = atoi(optarg);
00086             break;
00087         case 's':
00088             conf->snap_len = atoi(optarg);
00089             break;
00090         case 'e':
00091             snprintf(conf->filter_app, 100, "%s",optarg);
00092             break;
00093         case 't':
00094             fileAdminTime = atoi(optarg);
00095             break;
00096         case 'z':
00097             fileExpTime = atoi(optarg);
00098             break;
00099         case 'l':
00100             snprintf(logFileName,100, "%s",optarg);
00101             break;
00102         case 'r':
00103             offLineFile = optarg;
00104             break;
00105         case 'h':
00106             printHelp( argv[0] );
00107             return 0;
00108         case '?':
00109             if (isprint(optopt)){
00110                 fprintf(stderr, "Unknown option `-%c'.\n", optopt);
00111                 fprintf(stderr, "Use \"%s -h\" to see valid options\n", argv[0] );
00112             } else {
00113                 fprintf(stderr, "Unknown option character `\\x%x'.\n", optopt);
00114                 fprintf(stderr, "Use \"%s -h\" to see valid options\n", argv[0] );
00115                 }
00116             return 1;
00117         default:
00118             abort();
00119         }
00120     }
00121     for (index = optind; index < argc; index++) {
00122         printf("Non-option argument %s\n", argv[index]);
00123     }
00124     printf("Starting program...\n");
00125     fflush(stdout);
00126     analyserpxError = analyserpxStart(conf, fileAdminTime, fileExpTime, offLineFile);
00127     if (analyserpxError) {
00128         printf("\nThe program will exit with erro code %d\n", analyserpxError);
00129     }
00130     else{
00131         printf("Capture complete.\n");
00132     }
00133     fprintf(stdout, "%s\n","deve deletar");
00134     freeExpressions();
00135     fprintf(stdout, "%s - OK\n","deve deletar");
00136     free(conf);
00137     return 0;
00138 }
